name: arbitrarily
content:
arbitrarily adverb
(BY CHANCE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is based on chance rather than being planned or based on reason: We made the decision to go to Italy quite arbitrarily. He arbitrarily decided to take the part.
More examplesFewer examplesThey just arbitrarily pick a number.You can't just arbitrarily say that there are going to be 500 more students. We didn't make these changes arbitrarily, but for a good reason.

arbitrarily adverb
(UNFAIRLY)
disapproving in a way that uses personal power unfairly and without considering people's rights and wishes: Local officials enforce rules arbitrarily and unreasonably.
More examplesFewer examplesPeople have been held incommunicado for decades without trial and killed arbitrarily.The clergy became a ruling class that arbitrarily made decrees affecting people's lives.The police arrested and detained people arbitrarily.
